intro: Mezierea salaziensis var. comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian mezierea, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
